Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Clarification \Clar`i*fi*ca"tion\, n. [Cf. F. clarification, L. clarificatio glorification.] 1. The act or process of making clear or transparent, by freeing visible impurities; as, the clarification of wine. [1913 Webster]
2. The act of freeing from obscurities. [1913 Webster]
The clarification of men's ideas. --Whewell. [1913 Webster]

clarification n 1: an interpretation that removes obstacles to understanding; "the professor's clarification helped her to understand the textbook" [syn: {elucidation}, {illumination}] 2: the act of removing solid particles from a liquid [syn: {clearing}]
